title: Change of Condition — Pain Protocol (LTC/SNF)
summary: A structured pain assessment and follow-through workflow for older adults, including red flags, functional impact, and documentation elements.

sections.heading: Assess pain systematically
sections.body: Assess location, onset, quality, intensity (0–10), duration, aggravating/relieving factors, functional impact (mobility, sleep, appetite), and associated symptoms. For residents with dementia or limited verbal ability, use an observational tool (e.g., PAINAD) and behavioral cues.

sections.heading: Red flags requiring escalation
sections.body: Chest pain, new neuro deficits, severe abdominal pain with rigidity, uncontrolled bleeding, new severe shortness of breath, suspected fracture, or sudden 'worst pain' should trigger immediate escalation per facility protocol.

sections.heading: Follow-through
sections.body: Check vitals if pain is new/worsening or severe. Review recent events (fall, procedure), bowel/urinary status, wounds, and medication timing/effect. Implement ordered interventions (non-pharm and pharmacologic per orders), then reassess and document response within a defined timeframe.

sections.heading: Documentation elements (survey-ready)
sections.body: Document: pain assessment details; nonverbal cues if applicable; interventions performed per orders; resident response; education; provider notifications and orders received; monitoring plan.

references.label: Practice guideline review: pain assessment in older adults; PAINAD and domains
